ANU.name: John Reid
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Creative Arts Media And Communication Curriculum And Pedagogy
interest: Aesthetic visualisation of human rights and environmental issues. Visual artist and community engagement about environmental issues. Software development for supervision of remote field research.
ANU.biography: John Reid has a humanities degree from ANU, a masters of fine arts from UNSW and professional qualifications in graphic design. Held an ANU Creative Arts Fellowship (1977-79). Joined the Canberra School of Art in 1978. As a visual artist, works with photography, performance and collage to address human rights and environmental issues.
project: Designed display typeface, Process, Letraset International's Letragraphica Range (1973). Designed School of Art logo (1979). ANU Creative Art Fellowship exhibition From the Armchair. An essay in Medium Detail, (1981). Sustained national media coverage for artworks dealing with political disappearances (ntitled. Collage of Australian banknotes, 1984 -) and forest conservation (Fishman of SE Australia, 1992 -) . Project collaborations culminating in exhibitions with ANUgreen - A Thousand Colours. Visual Art for a Green ANU ( 2000) and ANU National Institute for Environment - Factor of Ten. A Future Worth Having (2002). Establish National Environment Bank (2002). Carrick citation for student learning (2006). Awarded (with CPAS) ANU School of Art's first ARC Linkage Engaging Visions (2007-10) www.engagingvisions.com.au
